result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Jay Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary Jay Simpson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary Jay Simpson was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Zachary Jay Simpson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 14CF217.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 28, 2019 by 12:00 pm.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:

DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with James W., Michael K. or Thomas E.

-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days unless Agent finds it is not necessary and follow any recommended treatment.

03:55 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur.    Zachary Jay Simpson appeared. Agent Kara Rheingans appeared by video via Zoom. Court reviews file. Agent is okay with staying balance of condition time. Agent states DE is working with CPS, but hasn't verified with social worker yet. Agent states DE completed dv assessment with Restorative Services and didn't give any recommendations. Court STAYS balance of condition time effective immediately. Court will not set further Probation Review Hearing. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned at 4:01 PM.  gll
Probation review hearing on November 8, 2021 at 04:00 pm.
DE's "goals" to reduce conflict. To EFV for review. bph

03:11 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur.   Zachary Jay Simpson pro se. Court notes hearing was set for 4PM, but DE arrived early, so Court was willing to call case early. Court questions Defendant. DE called Restorative Services and scheduled victim impact panel. DE states he had first impact panel last week and next impact panel is next month. DE states he paid $200 to probation. DE is on EHM until December. DE has been working as much as be can- he worked 55-60 hours last week. DE spends time with his daughter when he has free time. Court will have JA contact Agent in a month to make sure DV assessment has been completed, as well as how Agent is feeling about staying remaining condition time. DE has had no law enforcement contact since last hearing. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned at 3:20 PM. Clerk faxed minutes to probation.  gll
Probation review hearing on September 22, 2021 at 04:00 pm.

04:13 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur.     Zachary Jay Simpson pro se. Agent Hooyman appeared. Court reviews file. DE is currently serving 6 month sanction. DE needs to complete dv assessment and get caught up on probation fees. Court sets further PRH and DE is to bring copy of DV assessment. DE updates address and confirms  phone number. Adjourned at 4:17 PM.  gll  Probation review hearing scheduled for September 22, 2021 at 04:00 pm.

09:47 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur.  DF:  Zachary Jay Simpson appeared from jail, pro se. Agent Rheingans appeared. Defendant states he saw a letter from Agent and email. Defendant understands that Agent is requesting 6 months jail and doesn't wish to speak with an atty. Court questions agent regarding last violation, as indiciated in her letter. Agent states Defendant and upstairs neighbor were having disagreements regarding Defendant's noise and parties. Defendant also made a threat against neighbor on social media. Agent further states that she asked Defendant to cease and desist behavior and eventually was taken into custody for actions. Court questions Defendant. Court orders Defendant to serve 6 months jail with no good time. Court further orders Defendant to complete evidence-based Domestic Violence Assessment and successfully complete any follow-through. Court will allow huber for work and treatment including completing DV assessment. Court sets further Probation Review Hearing IN PERSON to make sure DV Assessment is completed. Court will allow Agent to appear by Zoom. Agent states Defendant hasn't made regular payments through probation. Adjourned at 9:56 AM.  gll  Probation review hearing scheduled for July 21, 2021 at 04:15 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Adam P Nero, DF: Zachary Jay Simpson appeared.  Lisa Multhauf from the Diversion Program.  Court called.  Includes case 14CF217 & 14CF252.  Motion to Revoke.  ADA Mckinley advises the DE has not totally completed his MRT and has a new OWI charge in Minnesota.  Attorneys will have off record discussions to see if they can reach a resolution. Recess at 9:21 a.m.  Case recalled at 9:50 a.m.   Attorney Nero makes a statement.  ADA Mckinley makes statement and argument.  Court orders the DE to adjust his work schedule to complete the MRT.  Court orders the New Richmond Service Center to put the DE at the top of their list for his evaluation and then treatment.  Discussions with attorneys and the DE about his current work schedule.  Over the objection of the State court denies the revocation.  Court adjourned.  lw

**AMENDED**

INCLUDES 14CF217 AND 14CF252

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Carey, ADA: A McKinley, DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Zachary Jay Simpson appeared.  Includes 14CF217, 14CF252, 14CF253 and 14CF254.  Agreement outlined, def will plead to 4 misdemeanors and placed on probation with a DJOC on 2 felony counts.  Court reviews consequences of felony conviction.  Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights.  
14CF217 - Court reads charge and possible penalties,  Ct 1 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty.  Court stays adjudication pending full performance of the DJOC presented to the Court.  Ct 2 and 3 dismissed.  
14CF252 - Court reads charge and possible penalties for Ct 1 - def pleads guilty.  Ct 3 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudicates def guilty of both counts.  Court stays adjudication for Ct 1 pending full performance of the DJOC presented to the Court.  Ct 3 - adjudication entered.  Ct 2 - dismissed. 
14CF253 - Court reads charge and possible penalties for Ct 2 & 3 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis and adjudicates def guilty of both counts.  Ct 1 - dismissed.
14CF254 - Court reads charges and possible penalties for Ct 2 - def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty.  Ct 1 - dismissed.

Sentence: withheld, 2 years probation (concurrent). 
14CF252 - Ct 3
14CF253 - Ct 2 & 3
14CF254 - Ct 2
Conditions to include:
- write apology letter to 3 victims within 30 days, submit to agent
- obtain high school diploma or GED
- obtain full time employment or attend school full time or a combination of the two
- 200 hrs community service as directed by agent
- no contact with any of the 3 victims except for apology letter
- complete restorative justice program to be determined by agent
- pay restitution TBD within 30 days (joint in several with co-def)
- costs total $972.00 to be paid within 60 days to the Clerk of Court 

Def to sign up for probation today.  Def eligible for expungement upon successful completion of the 4 year DJOC.   

14CF217 - Ct 1 and 14CF252 - Ct 1:  DJOC reviewed with def.  Court approves agreement and signs order.  Bond amended for these two files and will continue for duration of the agreement.  Other bonds are discharged.

Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

*INCLUDES 14CF252, 14CF253 AND 14CF254*

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Albert T. and his property; James W. and his property; Michael K. and his property; Andrew E.; Austin A.; D.R.M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Defendant to reside with parents on house arrest, and be in the presence of parent at all times; except while working. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
